title: Irving Interchange construction
text:
The first phase of construction of the expansion of SH 183 through Irving and into west Dallas took place from 2015 to 2018 (see photos on separate page). Phase 1 included ramps on the northwest side of the interchange at SH 183 and Loop 12.

In 2021, work began on the $301 million Irving Interchange project, which focuses on the interchange at SH 183 and Loop 12. The Irving Interchange project will complete all freeway work at the site of the former Texas Stadium, including SH 183, SH 114, Loop 12 and Spur 482.

images.caption: In 2021 work focused on the east side of Loop 12, mainly the SH 482 connections. This view looks east along the eastbound SH 183 feeder, with Maryland Street ahead.
This view shows work near Maryland street, for new connections to SH 482.
This view shows work near Maryland street, for new connections to SH 482.
Driving eastbound on SH 482 as it connects to SH 183
Looking north-northeast along Loop 12, just south of SH 183.
Looking west along SH 183 at the connections for Spur 482 in September 2022.
In September 2022 work was proceeding rapidly on the main interchange at SH 183 and Loop 12. This view looks east along SH 183 on the west side of the interchange.
Looking east along SH 183 on the west side of the interchange.
This view looks north along Loop 12 on the southwest side of the interchange.
Looking north along Loop 12 on the southwest side of the interchange.
Looking northwest on the southwest side of the interchange.
Looking northwest on the southeast side of the interchange.
On the southwest side of the interchange, the EB-SB ramp passes very close to the existing structure, which is a heavy equipment service facility.
Looking north along Loop 12 on the south side of the interchange.
Looking north along Loop 12 on the south side of the interchange.
Looking northeast on the south side of the interchange.
Looking north on the south side of the interchange.
Looking west along SH 183 on the east side of the interchange.
